column1: The  National Medicines Regulatory Authority Act contains stringent standards
that an  applicant  seeking  the  registration  of a drug  must  meet  and  detailed

provisions  with 
regard 
to 
the  steps 
that  should  be 
taken 
by 
the  1st

Respondent  prior  to 
the 
registration  of  a  drug.6  The  Petitioner  has  not
produced any material to establish that the registration by the 1st  Respondent

of  the  said  gel,  as  evidenced  by 
irregular  or  that  the  said 
'PS',  has  been

registration 
should 
be 
cancelled. 
In 
the  absence  of  any  evidence  of
wrongdoing  by  the  1st  Respondent,  this  Court does  not see  any  merit in  this
application  nor any legal  basis to issue the Writs of Certiorari and  Mandamus
